page.title: 01Valley of the Clyde
page.content: Block 02800645 contains the small sleepy village of Crossford and, a good sttretch of the River Clyde flows swiftly through and has occasionally been known to badly flood the village. The surrounding land is used mainly for farming i.e grazing, atlhough some is used for fruit growing and market gardening. One of the most famous products of this area is the tomato, which is grown in some of the vast glasshouse, situated in and around the village. Also contained in the block are the small villages of Tillietudlem and Netherburn, but these have few houses and certainly no industry. The people who live in this area have to travel some distance to work as there is very little in the way of employment here.
